name: Aron Nimzowitsch
description: A hypermodern and positional player, known for prophylaxis, piece maneuvering, and deep strategic concepts.

explanation.Aggressiveness: Nimzowitsch was primarily a positional player, but he also sought control of the board. Increased to 35 so he actively fights for space and initiative.
explanation.RiskTaking: Although cautious, he was not completely risk-averse. Setting this to 30 allows him to take more strategic risks when needed.
explanation.KingSafety: King safety remains important but reduced to 25 so he doesn’t over-prioritize passive safety.
explanation.PieceActivity: Nimzowitsch's hypermodern style relied on active piece play. Increasing this to 90 ensures he maneuvers pieces effectively.
explanation.PawnStructure: He strongly emphasized structure and prophylaxis. Keeping this high at 65 maintains his solid positional foundation.
explanation.KnightPair: Bonus for keeping both knights. He valued maneuvering, but knights were not his primary focus, so 60 is assigned.
explanation.BishopPair: Though he favored minor piece maneuvering, bishops were strong in his plans, hence 55.
explanation.Defense: Nimzowitsch was highly prophylactic, but reducing defense to 60 ensures he isn’t too passive.
explanation.CalculationDepth: His deep strategic vision is reflected by increasing CalculationDepth to 18 for better planning.
explanation.EndgameKnowledge: He excelled in endgames due to structural mastery. Keeping this high at 90 ensures strong endgame play.
explanation.PieceSacrifice: Though not a tactical player, he sometimes sacrificed pieces for positional gains. Increasing to 35 allows for calculated sacrifices.
